definition: pronunciation/literary (rather than colloquial) pronunciation of a Chinese character
to read/to study/reading of word (i.e. pronunciation), similar to 拼音[pin1 yin1]
sound/noise/note (of musical scale)/tone/news/syllable/reading (phonetic value of a character)

sentences.english: I will try to get something more pronounciation oriented soon.
sentences.chinese: 我會盡量讓更多的讀音爲導向很快。

sentences.english: The difference, says Dehaene, is how the words sound in your head.
sentences.chinese: 戴亞奈認爲這種區別在於人腦中單詞的讀音。

sentences.english: Work on the different pronunciations of the letter o.
sentences.chinese: 學習字母o在單詞中的讀音。

sentences.english: Characters in which the phonetic provides no information for pronunciation of the whole character, like phonetic-unknown character.
sentences.chinese: 聲旁不提供漢字讀音的信息，如聲旁不知字。

sentences.english: This Fanqie phonetic, is now "tea" the word pronunciation.
sentences.chinese: 這個反切注音，就是現在“茶”字的讀音。

sentences.english: The handwritten characters on this piece of paper are the corrected pronunciations of those Chinese characters.
sentences.chinese: 這張紙上的草體是修改過的漢字讀音。

sentences.english: Instead, the Egyptian pronunciation of his name is the norm for English transliteration.
sentences.chinese: 但是埃及阿拉伯語的讀音則更接近於英語的音譯。

sentences.english: Loved the giggly sound of the name I'd given it.
sentences.chinese: 愛我自己給它起的名字讀音。

sentences.english: I emphasized the pronunciation of the words.
Words written alike are often pronounced differently.
sentences.chinese: 拼法相同的詞往往讀音不同。

sentences.english: She took it as a schoolbook which she used to learn the rules of pronunciation.
sentences.chinese: 她先把詞典當作教科書，利用它來學習讀音規則。

definition: style of writing (literary style)/way of writing a character/spelling
the four tones of Middle Chinese: level tone 平聲|平声, rising tone 上聲|上声, departing tone 去聲|去声 and entering tone 入聲|入声/the four tones of Modern Standard Mandarin
consonant/the initial consonant (of a Chinese syllable)
entering tone/checked tone/one of the four tones of Middle Chinese
vocabulary/list of words (e.g. for language teaching purposes)/word
the final of a Chinese syllable (the component of a syllable remaining after removal of the initial consonant, if any, and the tone, e.g. the final of "niáng" is "iang")
tone/note/a tone (on a Chinese syllable)/CL:個|个[ge4]
